intro: Catabrosa concinna subsp. algidiformis, commonly known as the alpine catabrosa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
